fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A report about female genital mutilation in England (Figures show FGM has become ‘worryingly prevalent’, 30 November, page 26) said the number of girls who had experienced or were believed to be at risk of the practice had “more than doubled” in a year, according to local authority figures. After publication, the source data, from the Department for Education, was found to have a fundamental error in the number of cases reported in Northamptonshire. Using the correct figures, the number of FGM cases in England fell from 970 in 2016-17 to 940 in 2017-18. • Other recently corrected articles include: Robert Morris obituary Turner prize winner Charlotte Prodger on gender confusion, ‘filthy’ iPhones and solitude Tsunami warning for Vanuatu and New Caledonia after 7.6 magnitude earthquake
